title: Does Bollywood copy songs & music from foreign songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, it does. In the past, they have regularly taken an American tune, and altered it, added a new beat or slowed down the tempo, or just used one refrain and made the rest original. However, now, the music industry is more and more international and they are beginning to officially buy the rights for their songs. For Kal Ho Na Ho, they officially bought the rights to “Pretty Woman” and for Ra.One, they officially bought the rights to “Stand By Me.” The same thing is happening with scripts. There are still plenty of producers who do shot by shot remakes of American films, or are “inspired” by an American film (for instance, Airlift and Argo which I discuss in more detail here). But the rights to Knight and Day were officially purchased for the remake, Bang Bang. And the same director is now working on an official remake of the Rambo films.

Yes, he did. I mean to say, Pritam Chakraborty. He copied many Indonesian songs. These are the lists: 2 songs from Peterpan band (now named Noah): Tak Bisakah become Kya Mujhe Pyaar Hai (Woh Lamhe soundtrack) & Di Belakangku become Aao Milo Chale (Jab We Met soundtrack)1 song from Iwan Fals, Indonesian legendary singer: Bongkar become Oya Oya (Horn OK Please soundtrack). But he only copied verse 1 & Reff part of Bongkar song.Problems with Peterpan has solved on 2006. Indonesian recording company that record Peterpan songs had sent the manager & the lawyer to meet Pritam in Mumbai. Pritam admitted he copied Peterpan songs.
